abstract: A global mining company, Rio Tinto, defended itself on Monday against shareholder criticism of its proposed $19.5 billion tie-up with China’s state-owned Chinalco, its rejection of a takeover bid by BHP Billiton and its costly 2007 purchase of Alcan.
